encyclopedia.content: Quebec Que.bec AHD:[kw1-bμk“] 或 Qué.bec [k3-] D.J.[kwi6bek]或 Qué.bec [kei] K.K.[kw!6bWk]或 Qué.bec [ke] NONE（无词性） (1) Abbr. PQ, P.Q., Que.A province of eastern Canada. It joined the confederacy in 1867. The region was first explored and claimed for France by Jacques Cartier (1534) and Samuel de Champlain (1608) and was made a royal colony, known as New France, by Louis XIV in 1663. Co

means.word_mean: 1. the French-speaking capital of the province of Quebec; situated on the Saint Lawrence River
2. the largest province of Canada; a French colony from 1663 to 1759 when it was lost to the British

sentences.en: After farming for ten years,he sold up and went to Quebec.
sentences.cn: 他经营了十年农场后,变卖了全部财产前往魁北克。

sentences.en: After roaming around nearly half his life,he finally settled down in Quebec.
sentences.cn: 他过了半辈子的流浪生活,最后在魁北克定居了下来。
